item.description:
Mount Moosilauke
7-8 hour hike
Difficulty: Moderate
Elevation Gain: 3,40


Be prepared to hike with this group as a group our motto is: We go in as a group and we come out as a group. We will hike at a pace of our slowest hiker.

We all have our own individual pace and many organizers offer many levels of hiking to give you options of the level and pace that is comfortable for you.



We will be hiking Mt. Moosilaukee via the Glencliff Trail to the summit of Mt. Moosilauke. The total distance covered is eight miles and should take approximately seven hours.

Description:

This trail runs from High St. (formerly Sanatorium Rd.) to the Moosilauke Carriage Rd. in a sag just north of Moosilaukeâ€™s South Peak. It is part of the AT. There is only one steep section, and the footing is generally good. The trailhead parking area is on the right a short distance past the trail sign; from here, one may follow an old farm road past a gate. The upper part is above the treeline and greatly exposed to the elements, so it can be dangerous in bad weather.

Mountain weather is subject to rapid changes and extreme conditions. We will assess travel and weather conditions during our hike and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

Being prepared, traveling with the appropriate gear & knowing how to use it is your personal responsibility. Test and adjust your gear prior to this trip. Snowshoes,crampons, and micro spikes a must!!

!! NO COTTON CLOTHING !! - Cotton (a.k.a. the death cloth) has no place in the mountains. If you arrive wearing cotton clothing you will be turned away.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: Mt Moosilauke
